key_risks: Legal and financial challenges including class action lawsuits and settlements
Revenue decline due to weak printer sales
Intense competition from companies like Stratasys, HP, and Desktop Metal
Supply chain vulnerabilities affecting production and delivery
Slow adoption of 3D printing technologies in traditional manufacturing sectors
controversies: Class action lawsuit alleging misleading investors about internal financial controls
Settlements and fines totaling up to $27 million with U.S. government departments
Labor relations and workplace safety violations including fines from NLRB and OSHA
Reports of layoffs indicating possible internal restructuring or financial difficulties
environmental_issues: Low ESG risk rating (19.5) indicating room for improvement in sustainability practices
social_issues: Labor relations and workplace safety violations
Reports of layoffs affecting workforce morale and stability
governance_issues: Low ESG risk rating (19.5) indicating room for improvement in governance practices
Leadership changes with the appointment of a new CEO in 2023

sources.title: New Class Action Lawsuit Accuses 3D Systems of Misleading Investors
sources.snippet: A new class action lawsuit filed in New York federal court accuses 3D Systems Corporation of misleading investors about the company's internal financial controls. The proposed class action was filed April 9 by Plaintiff Troy Kehoe on behalf of anyone who purchased publicly traded securities of 3D Systems between May 6, 2020 and March 1, 2021.

sources.title: 3D Systems, Investors Get Sign-Off for $4 Million Settlement

sources.title: Barranco v. 3D Systems Corp., No. 18-16708 (9th Cir. 2020)
sources.snippet: Plaintiff filed suit against 3D Systems for breach of contract and breach of the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, among other claims. Plaintiff's claims arose out of a purchase and sale agreement (PSA) documenting 3D Systems' acquisition of 3D printing websites from plaintiff. 3D Systems counterclaimed that plaintiff breached a covenant not to compete (CNTC) contained in the PSA.
